channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Is Pushing the U.S.-Europe Alliance to the Brink Over Greenland
item.description: As President Trump tries to coerce European leaders over Greenland, they are pondering the unthinkable: Is an 80-year-old alliance doomed?

item.title: Gaza’s Board of Peace: What to Know
item.description: Numerous countries say they have been invited to join President Trump’s newly minted organization, which critics say could undermine the United Nation...

item.title: Protest at Minnesota Church Service Adds to Tensions Over ICE Tactics
item.description: The Justice Department said it would investigate the protest over a pastor’s apparent role in immigration enforcement in the state.

item.title: The curious case of the ICE pastor as Minnesota protesters disrupt church services and DOJ launches investigation
item.description: "To have someone serving as a pastor who oversees these ICE agents, is almost unfathomable to me,” said Nekima Levy Armstrong, a reverend herself.

item.title: The U.S. Supreme Court could throw a wrench into Trump’s plan to take Greenland as soon as Tuesday
item.description: If the court rules that the president does not have "emergency" powers to regulate routine international trade then his latest threats on Greenland wo...

item.title: PwC’s global chairman says most leaders have forgotten ‘the basics’ as 56% are still getting ‘nothing’ out of AI adoption
item.description: PwC's Mohamed Kande talked to Fortune about the "tri-modal mandate" for leaders to execute, transform and build: "I've not seen that in 25 years."

item.title: Trump’s Gaza ‘Board of Peace’ extends invitations to Russia, Belarus and Thailand along with EU
item.description: It's unclear how many leaders have been invited to join the board.

item.title: Trump says he wants Greenland because he was rejected for a Nobel Peace Prize last year
item.description: The president revealed his motivation in a text message to Norway's Prime Minister, who has no say over Nobel awards.

item.title: Survivors of Deadly Train Crash in Spain Describe Hellish Scenes
item.description: Photographs show a tangled mess of metal, wires and broken glass at the scene of the crash, which killed at least 39 people.

item.title: Spain Scrutinizes Break in Track After 2 Trains Collide, Killing 40
item.description: Crews were working to retrieve bodies after two high-speed trains derailed in southern Spain. The regional authorities said 41 people were hospitalize...

item.title: Gaza’s Board of Peace: What to Know
item.description: Numerous countries say they have been invited to join President Trump’s newly minted organization, which critics say could undermine the United Nation...

item.title: Slow Emergency Response Blamed in Deadly Pakistan Mall Fire
item.description: The blaze, which killed at least 23 and left dozens more missing during “wedding season,” burned all night and day through a Karachi plaza with hundre...

item.title: How 40 People Died In a Train Crash in Andalucia, Spain
item.description: The victims of Spain’s deadliest rail crash in more than a decade included a police officer, journalists and a family returning from a musical.

item.title: Federal Reserve Inquiry Clouds Trump’s Supreme Court Bid to Oust Lisa Cook
item.description: The court is set to hear Ms. Cook’s case challenging her firing as the Justice Department investigates Jerome H. Powell, the central bank chair.

item.title: Taxing the Ultrarich
item.description: The number of billionaires has exploded, yet they often pay taxes at rates well below average.
